Osama Mahmoud

Research Associate in Statistics / R Expert

Osama Mahmoud

Research Associate in Statistics / R Expert
This is a beta version of my website. The site, in a full shape, should be launched by 1st January 2017. Therefore, I should be in touch with you soon :)

Research Associate in Statistics, University of Bristol, United Kingdom.

  • NIHR Bristol Nutrition Biomedical Research Unit (BRU).
  • School of Oral and Dental Sciences (SODS).
  • School of Social and Community Medicine (SSCM).

Expertise

My expertise lies within Medical Statistics and Bio-statistics domains with extensive practice of:

  • Classification and Clustering techniques.
  • Analysing high dimensional data sets, particularly from functional genomic experiments.
  • Multilevel Modelling.

My research projects have led to a track record of publications in a number of high quality journals.

I have an extensive experience on writing software commands, mainly using R, for newly developed statistical techniques as well as for applying effectively existing methods. I am an author for a number of R packages published on the CRAN.

Furthermore, I am running a number of statistical courses using R at several locations across Europe. I do deliver courses on-sites as well. If you are representing an institution interested in finding out more details, please feel free to contact me.

Research Interests

My research interests are diverse covering a range of methodological as well as applied statistical areas.

A brief list of my research interests includes:

  • Medical Statistics.
  • Machine Learning Techniques.
  • Statistical Modelling.
  • Statistical Methods for High Throughput Data Sets.
  • Statistics for Public Health.
  • Genetic Epidemiology.
